reporting-org.narrative: AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development

title.narrative: Sustainable return and reintegration of afghan refugees and IDPs

description.narrative: Il progetto, implementato da UNHCR, è finanziato con un contributo volontario di 2 milioni de euro e prevede la durata di 1 anno. Questo progetto mira ad assicurare le necessità di protezione di: i) i rifugiati afgano ritornati, ii) Profughi interni Afghani (IDPs) iii) le comunità vulnerabili, incluse le popolazioni miste (residenti e rifugiati), in aree urbane e peri-urbane con un alto numero di profughi con particolare enfasi per le donne. Il progetto contribuirà al raggiungimento agli obiettivi strategici generali di UNHCR: 1) Facilitare il rimpatrio volontario di rifugiati afgani; 2) Sostenere la co-esistenza pacifica tra le comunità ospitanti e i rifugiati rimpatriati registrati per rendere l’integrazione più sostenibile; 3) Rafforzare i servizi per i rifugiati rimpatriati registrati e vulnerabili, IDPs e rifugiati identificati attraverso il programma “Persone con Specifiche Necessità” (PSN). Le attività includeranno: • Gestione di quattro “Centri di registrazione” (encashment center) e il pagamento del cash grant per i rifugiati ritornati e registrati; • Attività di protezione “Community Based” aggiornate tramite il monitoraggio della protezione. • Assistenza a persone con necessità specifiche. I beneficiari diretti saranno 6,500 rifugiati che ritornano in Afghanistan che riceveranno il “Cash Grants” e 600 rifugiati repatriati e IDPs con specifiche necessità. Il progetto prevede anche di quattro iniziative “community based” di protezione in aree di reinsediamento dei repatriati e/o IDPs di cui beneficeranno anche le popolazioni locali.

The project, implemented by UNHCR, is financed with a voluntary contribution of 2 million euros and foresees a duration of 1 year. This project aims to ensure the protection needs of: i) returned Afghan refugees, ii) Afghan internal refugees (IDPs) iii) vulnerable communities, including mixed populations (residents and refugees), in urban and peri-urban areas with a high number of refugees with particular emphasis on women.The project will contribute to achieving UNHCR's overall strategic objectives:1) Facilitating the voluntary repatriation of Afghan refugees;2) Support peaceful co-existence between host communities and registered repatriated refugees to make integration more sustainable;3) Strengthen services for registered and vulnerable repatriated refugees, IDPs and refugees identified through the "People with Specific Needs" (NDP) program.The activities will include:• Management of four "Registration Centers" (encashment centers) and payment of the cash grant for returned and registered refugees;• "Community Based" protection activities updated through protection monitoring.• Assistance to people with specific needs. The direct beneficiaries will be 6,500 refugees returning to Afghanistan who will receive the "Cash Grants" and 600 repatriated refugees and IDPs with specific needs. The project also foresees four "community based" protection initiatives in areas of resettlement of repatriates and / or IDPs, which will also benefit local populations.

tag.narrative: By 2030, build the resilience of the poor and those in vulnerable situations and reduce their exposure and vulnerability to climate-related extreme events and other economic, social and environmental shocks and disasters
By 2030, eradicate extreme poverty for all people everywhere, currently measured as people living on less than $1.25 a day
End poverty in all its forms everywhere
Implement nationally appropriate social protection systems and measures for all, including floors, and by 2030 achieve substantial coverage of the poor and the vulnerable
